commit_message:
Clarify the project retirement vs project's repository retirement

In TC house rule, we introduced the project-updates topic so that
we can speed up the process for updates (including addition or retirement
of repository) in existing projects. But this was not meant for the
retirement of complete project. Any retirement of complete project
or a new project application are the big change in OpenStack umbrella
and should require the detailed discussion. That is why it should fall
under formal-vote topic.

For retiring the projct, we have been using the mixed topic where
sometime we use formal-vote and sometime project-updates.

Clarfiy the same in our house rule doc also.

Change-Id: I591c92fb84b5ca22905cf703be3c27f690899513
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/84/919984/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: addition of a new git repository or retirement of existing repository of project. If there is no objection posted after the addition or retirement of a repository in existing project is proposed (assuming the correct retirement process has been followed), then the change can be approved by the chair if it has at least two 2 roll call votes (which can include the vote of the chair and excludes the change owner) and a code review vote from the PTL of the project (or their delegate).A new project application or retirement of a project should be approved by a formal vote after discussion on the mailing list or the gerrit change.
deleted_lines: addition of a new git repository or retirement. If there is no objection posted after the addition or retirement of a project is proposed (assuming the correct retirement process has been followed), then the change can be approved by the chair if it has at least two 2 roll call votes (which can include the vote of the chair and excludes the change owner) and a code review vote from the PTL of the project (or their delegate).

Even in case when resource definition don't have project_id nor
tenant_id in its API definition it is always there because it is added
from the neutron_context.
Because of that reason, it was necessary to add those attributes to the
list of attributes of all resources, even those which don't really
belong to any specific project (like e.g. flavors or QoS rules).

This patch adds project_id and tenant_id to the list of the expected
attributes always so it won't fail validation of the attributes during
e.g. creation of the flavor even if flavor resource don't have

Change-Id: Ib25295e666e7230f9d6c7c5df83411014d5b6ac2

commit_message:
Always expect project_id and tenant_id to be in the attributes list

Even in case when resource definition don't have project_id nor
tenant_id in its API definition it is always there because it is added
from the neutron_context.
Because of that reason, it was necessary to add those attributes to the
list of attributes of all resources, even those which don't really
belong to any specific project (like e.g. flavors or QoS rules).

This patch adds project_id and tenant_id to the list of the expected
attributes always so it won't fail validation of the attributes during
e.g. creation of the flavor even if flavor resource don't have
project_id defined.

Additionally this patch removes project_id from the flavors and QoS
rules definitions.

Closes-bug: #2022043
Change-Id: Ib25295e666e7230f9d6c7c5df83411014d5b6ac2

commit_message:
Pin version of ansible-collection-kubernetes

Pin prior to OSA Caracal release - ideally this would be a released
version of the collection but OSA requires a recent patch that is
not yet included in a release.

Change-Id: I54acd63939f2e9f87554446d4c33a155a3ffe812

commit_message:
Apply label to control plane k8s nodes to allow cluster-autoscaler to run

Kubernetes cluster-autoscaler only runs on nodes with a specific label
so add task to set required label(s) on control-plane k8s nodes.

Change-Id: I9bf371ad1ba5d80b7e5a950ac1d60499788d9d0d

commit_message:
Enhance security notes in config description

Some of the configuation knobs require more specific details
regarding security or denial of service related possibilities
if tuned to inappropriate values.

Overall, just some minor improvements for clarity

Change-Id: I008d6e00a528bddba0f843f34968155a9da3ff36

commit_message:
Add gnocchi and ceilometer to cloudkity installation

By default Cloudkitty leverages gnocchi as source of data. In order to
make AIO deployment meaningfull, we need to ensure that it will be
installed as well.
Ceilometer is needed to provide data to Gnocchi, so that metering become
possible.

Related-Bug: #2067084
Change-Id: I145f474e3c34fd4ccf447699ca1e6ca970f54600
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/30/920430/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Implement a new cloud-sync multi-site relation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-10-24 11:38:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-radosgw/commit/0c1335bffe371f5699052e367553602632d4a9c6', 'message': 'Implement a new cloud-sync multi-site relation

The new relation is based on the Ceph cloud sync module:
https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/radosgw/cloud-sync-module/

The cloud sync module leverages the same multi-site replication
framework, but instead of writing to a secondary Ceph cluster, it
writes to an S3 (or S3-compatible) target.

The S3 target connection credentials are obtained through a new
relation with the s3-integrator charm.

This new relation behaves exactly as a secondary multi-site relation
(it implements the same interface), but it is used to configure the
cloud sync module for the primary RGW zone. The secondary Ceph RGW is
related to the Ceph Mons in the same cluster as the primary Ceph RGW.

Change-Id: Ia9b69d2f48e77f73b55a2036ae7845c0cbba8045
Signed-off-by: Ionut Balutoiu <ibalutoiu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

commit_message:
Implement a new cloud-sync multi-site relation

The new relation is based on the Ceph cloud sync module:
https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/radosgw/cloud-sync-module/

The cloud sync module leverages the same multi-site replication
framework, but instead of writing to a secondary Ceph cluster, it
writes to an S3 (or S3-compatible) target.

The S3 target connection credentials are obtained through a new
relation with the s3-integrator charm.

This new relation behaves exactly as a secondary multi-site relation
(it implements the same interface), but it is used to configure the
cloud sync module for the primary RGW zone. The secondary Ceph RGW is
related to the Ceph Mons in the same cluster as the primary Ceph RGW.

Change-Id: Ia9b69d2f48e77f73b55a2036ae7845c0cbba8045
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1176
Signed-off-by: Ionut Balutoiu <ibalutoiu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

commit_message:
Define unique hostname for QManager

Due to the shortcoming of QManager implementation [1], in case of uWSGI
usage on metal hosts, the flow ends up with having the same
hostname/processname set, making services to fight over same file
under SHM.

In order to avoid this, we prepend the hostname with a service_name.
We can not change processname instead, since it will lead to the fight
between different processes of the same service.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/2065922

Change-Id: I562e8d0a65b12aa8ce88caea2d7e955f78c3bf33

for true:TrueClass ...

commit_message:
Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to
  stable branches.

Change-Id: Icad101975cbc54789807964097251cb7041a7af3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceilometer refs/changes/04/917304/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Define unique hostname for QManager

Due to the shortcoming of QManager implementation [1], in case of uWSGI
usage on metal hosts, the flow ends up with having the same
hostname/processname set, making services to fight over same file
under SHM.

In order to avoid this, we prepend the hostname with a service_name.
We can not change processname instead, since it will lead to the fight
between different processes of the same service.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/2065922

Change-Id: If92f81bee0ffd3556e1b1e1f26e7572af04ff1b2

commit_message:
Assume structured fact in unit tests

The legacy fact has been deprecated and is no longer available in
Puppet 8. Use the structured one to access fact values in tests so that
we use the consistent method for fact value access.

Change-Id: I254e7fb0438a9f5f8a2319d5cef1457958313494

commit_message:
SQLAlchemy 2.0: Omnibus fixes patch

This was originally five patches, but they are all needed to pass
any of the test jobs now, so they have been squashed into one:

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith (dms@danplanet.com)

First:

The autoload argument was removed[1] in SQLAlchemy and only
the autoload_with argument should be passed.

The autoload argument is set according to the autoload_with argument
automatically even in SQLAlchemy 1.x[2] so is not at all needed.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/c932123bacad9bf047d160b85e3f95d396c513ae
[2] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/ad8f921e969b6f735dc8e08d882c961dde78f2b1

Second:

Remove _warn_on_bytestring for newer SA, AFAICT, this flag has been
removed from SQLAlchemy and that is why watcher-db-manage fails to
initialize the DB for me on jammy. This migration was passing the
default value (=False) anyway, so I assume this is the right "fix".

Third:

Fix joinedload passing string attribute names

Fourth:

Fix engine.select pattern to use begin() per the migration guide.

Fifth:

Override the apscheduler get_next_run_time() which appears to be
trivially not compatible with SQLAlchemy 2.0 because of a return type
from scalar().

Change-Id: I000e5e78f97f82ed4ea64d42f1c38354c3252e08

commit_message:
Restore Apache Zookeeper service

The reference driver for Tooz, which is used as a coordination
service by some OpenStack services, is based on Zookeeper [1,2].
We therefore bring back Zookeeper for this purpose.

[1] https://zookeeper.apache.org
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tooz/latest/user/drivers.html#zookeeper

This partially reverts commit 52a53927f5d390886c3940e364fe9fa888e3bc98.

Change-Id: I3995fa8124f9ec549fb48aa16d801898d33c8ac2

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG [1] and TC resolution [2], we are dropping the
lower-constraints.txt file and its testing. We will keep lower bounds
in the requirements.txt file but with a note that these are not tested
lower bounds and we try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html

Change-Id: Ib425c4791477803224460b536fe88c506e36d623
(cherry picked from commit fa1a31a44874d785ad7dd4d550f34ea18cf0d910)

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG [1] and TC resolution [2], we are dropping the
lower-constraints.txt file and its testing. We will keep lower bounds
in the requirements.txt file but with a note that these are not tested
lower bounds and we try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html

Change-Id: Ib425c4791477803224460b536fe88c506e36d623
(cherry picked from commit fa1a31a44874d785ad7dd4d550f34ea18cf0d910)

commit_message:
Use new sort method _sort_releases to support wrapped release names

Earlier trilio module was using sorted method to sort supported openstack releases,
but this method was causing issue for zed and yoga release and was considering antelope only.
With this change we are going to use the new method from core module _sort_releases which correctly handles
the situation.

Change-Id: I340d3b646d2472e751d01e2bf786ada7b19cbd3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack refs/changes/76/920876/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Replace renamed attribute_mapped_collection

SQLAlchemy 2.0[1].

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/orm/collection_api.html#sqlalchemy.orm.attribute_mapped_collection

Change-Id: I69755adcc4a93fcc0c74dae9941ad3d0ec30f097

commit_message:
Restore Apache Zookeeper service

The reference driver for Tooz, which is used as a coordination
service by some OpenStack services, is based on Zookeeper [1,2].
We therefore bring back Zookeeper for this purpose.

[1] https://zookeeper.apache.org
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tooz/latest/user/drivers.html#zookeeper

Depends-On: I3995fa8124f9ec549fb48aa16d801898d33c8ac2
Change-Id: I6c933c1598fd64e689cab40942598d214087248f

commit_message:
Install sudo on Debian/Ubuntu

Since other components (like the scripts for destroying deployments)
need ``sudo``, we should install the package on Debian-based
distributions as well.

Change-Id: I0f4ac473f52ccdfda4af6759304c3f023c8d47b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collection-kolla refs/changes/81/920881/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The ``sudo`` package is now installed on Debian/Ubuntu hosts.

commit_message:
[WIP] Implement L2 EVPN functionality

This change implements L2 EVPN functionality. It does this by extending the NB BGP driver with an additional exposing_method l2vni or dynamic.
The required EVPN info is grabbed from OVNs Logical_Switch table, where the change [1] will store it.
For now, this will only expose ports directly attached to instances on provider networks and distributed FIPs.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/+/883060

Related-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ovn-bgp-agent/+bug/2017890

Change-Id: I6f9c57c0a821413082645a1d9d4b96853f201583
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovn-bgp-agent refs/changes/90/886090/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add tag to enable targeting of post-install config elements only

<service>-config tags are quite broad and have a long execution
time. Where you only need to modify a service's '.conf' file and
similar it is useful to have a quicker method to do so.

Change-Id: I077eaa828c5f80647c5fabd1663436f9f1d1f958

commit_message:
FIX OVN LB Health Monitor checks for IPv6 members

After [1] the IPv6 backend members health checks are supported,
they are mapping into field ip_port_mappings of the OVN LB entity
and translated to OVN SB DB Service_Monitor entries, same way
for IPv4 ones.

However, IPv6 backend members require being enclosed in [ ], and
this was not occurring, causing it not to translate into entries
in the Service_Monitor table. This patch fixes this issue.

Furthermore, a one-time maintenance task has been developed to fix
those existing IPv6 Health Monitors directly upon the startup of
the ovn-octavia-provider component without requiring any action
by the administrator/user.

[1] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/40a686e8e70f4141464f7fe2c949ea5b9bf29060

Conflicts:
      ovn_octavia_provider/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py

Closes-Bug: #2055876
Change-Id: I9b97aa9e6c8d601bc9e465e6aa8895dcc2666568
(cherry picked from commit bd1137ad57b6e336800d701d6d52733abf968aa5)

commit_message:
add functional repoducer for bug 2065927

Today if the write sys call to offline a cpu when
deleting an instnace fails due to an OSERROR or ValueERROR
the instance delete fails and the instance goes to error.

as reported in bug: #2065927 this can happen as a result of
OSError: [Errno 16] Device or resource busy if the vm is
deleted shortly after its started.

Related-Bug: #2065927
Change-Id: I1352a3a1e28cfe14ec8f32042ed35cb25e70338e

added_lines: from unittest import mock from nova.tests.functional.api import client return server def test_delete_server(self): server = self.test_create_server() self._delete_server(server) # Let's verify that the pinned CPUs are now offline cpu_dedicated_set = hardware.get_cpu_dedicated_set() self._assert_cpu_set_state(cpu_dedicated_set, expected='offline') def test_delete_server_device_busy(self): server = self.test_create_server() inst = objects.Instance.get_by_uuid(self.ctxt, server['id']) instance_pcpus = inst.numa_topology.cpu_pinning self._assert_cpu_set_state(instance_pcpus, expected='online') with mock.patch( 'nova.filesystem.write_sys', side_effect=exception.FileNotFound(file_path='fake')): # This is bug 2065927 self.assertRaises( client.OpenStackApiException, self._delete_server, server) cpu_dedicated_set = hardware.get_cpu_dedicated_set() # Verify that the unused CPUs are still offline unused_cpus = cpu_dedicated_set - instance_pcpus self._assert_cpu_set_state(unused_cpus, expected='offline') # but the instance cpus are still online self._assert_cpu_set_state(instance_pcpus, expected='online')

commit_message:
Add tag to enable targeting of post-install config elements only

<service>-config tags are quite broad and have a long execution
time. Where you only need to modify a service's '.conf' file and
similar it is useful to have a quicker method to do so.

Change-Id: If65b1d0b28f2470d42ec885b450938c0085d2a3d

commit_message:
Remove stable/zed and add stable/caracal jobs

Zed is now "Unmaintained" and devstack no longer runs with it. This
patch removes the Zed job and adds a stable/2024.1 job.

Change-Id: I938c276561cb3916199f52beaa958ff22bb4790c

commit_message:
Add parameters to cinder backend configuration

Add configuration parameters cinder_store_user_name,
cinder_store_password, cinder_store_project_name and
cinder_store_auth_address to cinder volume type backend configuration.
This avoids a glance_store bug that prevents glance-api from starting.

Closes-Bug: #2052726
Change-Id: I4b6ca32ed426f77a326711c2457046dbda594e77
(cherry picked from commit 07da644b2ba6a2371cf7ef5249e196f18a3b8823)

commit_message:
Remove leftover OVN LB HM port upon deletion of a member

When a load balancer pool has a Health Monitor associated with it,
an OVN LB Health Monitor port is created for each backend member
subnet added.

When removing backend members, the OVN LB Health Monitor port is
cleaned up only if no more members are associated with the Health
Monitor pool. However, this assumption is incorrect. This patch
corrects this behavior by checking instead if there are more members
from the same subnet associated with the pool. It ensures that the
OVN LB Health Monitor port is deleted only when the last member from
the subnet is deleted. If the port is being used by another different
LB Health Monitor, `_clean_up_hm_port` will handle it.

Closes-Bug: #2062965
Change-Id: I4c35cc5c6af14bb208f4313bb86e3519df0a30fa
(cherry picked from commit f034bab144b68cf96c538339e389c4cc7c6d7d63)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider refs/changes/26/917726/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(ovn_helper.OvnProviderHelper, '_find_ovn_lb_by_pool_id') @mock.patch.object(ovn_helper.OvnProviderHelper, '_update_hm_member') @mock.patch.object(ovn_helper.OvnProviderHelper, '_clean_up_hm_port') def test_member_delete_keep_hm_port(self, del_hm_port, uhm, folbpi): pool_key = 'pool_%s' % self.pool_id member2_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() member2_address = '192.168.2.150' member2_line = ( 'member_%s_%s:%s_%s' % (member2_id, member2_address, self.member_port, self.member_subnet_id)) self.ovn_hm_lb.external_ids[pool_key] = ','.join([self.member_line, member2_line]) self.ovn_hm_lb.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_MEMBER_STATUS_KEY] = \ '{"%s": "%s","%s": "%s"}' % (self.member_id, constants.ONLINE, member2_id, constants.ONLINE) folbpi.return_value = (pool_key, self.ovn_hm_lb) self.helper.member_delete(self.member) uhm.assert_called_once_with(self.ovn_hm_lb, pool_key, self.member_address, delete=True) del_hm_port.assert_not_called()

Remove leftover OVN LB HM port upon deletion of a member

When a load balancer pool has a Health Monitor associated with it,
an OVN LB Health Monitor port is created for each backend member
subnet added.

cleaned up only if no more members are associated with the Health

Closes-Bug: #2062965

subject: Adds a Cache for Volumes Created from Snapshots with Quobyte
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-12 12:37:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/579faa6d8d8cde51253d20702d7082960e9c2613', 'message': "[WIP] Adds a Cache for Volumes Created from Snapshots with Quobyte

In order to speed up the creation of multiple volumes from a single
snapshot this change adds a cache of volumes created by merging a
snapshots backing chain. This behaviour can be activated via a new
config option 'quobyte_volume_cache'.
Instead of merging a snapshots backing chain into a new volume each time
a volume is created from this snapshot, the new implementation merges the
backing chain into a volume in the new volume cache. New volumes to be
created from that snapshot are then copied from the cached volume and
no longer require the merging process.
Merging happens only for the first time when the cached volume copy is
created.

Change-Id: I2142b1c0a0cc2c4f85794416e702a326d3406b9d

This is not related to the Cinder image cache.

In order to speed up the creation of multiple volumes from a single
snapshot this change adds a cache of volumes created by merging a
snapshots backing chain to the Quobyte driver.
This behaviour can be activated via a new config option
'quobyte_volume_from_snapshot_cache'.
Instead of merging a snapshots backing chain into a new volume each time
a volume is created from this snapshot, the new implementation merges the
backing chain into a volume in the new volume cache. New volumes to be
created from that snapshot are then copied from the cached volume and
no longer require the merging process.
Merging happens only for the first time when the cached volume copy is
created from a specific snapshot. Subsequent creations of volumes from
this snapshot are simply copied from the cache which requires no costly
backing chain merge.
Adding a DocImpact flag for the new config option added in here.

DocImpact

Partial-Bug: #1715078

Change-Id: I2142b1c0a0cc2c4f85794416e702a326d3406b9d

commit_message:
Adds a Cache for Volumes Created from Snapshots with Quobyte

This is not related to the Cinder image cache.

In order to speed up the creation of multiple volumes from a single
snapshot this change adds a cache of volumes created by merging a
snapshots backing chain to the Quobyte driver.
This behaviour can be activated via a new config option
'quobyte_volume_from_snapshot_cache'.
Instead of merging a snapshots backing chain into a new volume each time
a volume is created from this snapshot, the new implementation merges the
backing chain into a volume in the new volume cache. New volumes to be
created from that snapshot are then copied from the cached volume and
no longer require the merging process.
Merging happens only for the first time when the cached volume copy is
created from a specific snapshot. Subsequent creations of volumes from
this snapshot are simply copied from the cache which requires no costly
backing chain merge.

Partial-Bug: #1715078

Change-Id: I2142b1c0a0cc2c4f85794416e702a326d3406b9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/74/502974/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import tempfilefrom cinder.volume import utils def _get_fake_snapshot(self, src_volume): snapshot = fake_snapshot.fake_snapshot_obj( self.context, volume_name=src_volume.name, display_name='clone-snap-%s' % src_volume.id, size=src_volume.size, volume_size=src_volume.size, volume_id=src_volume.id, id=self.SNAP_UUID) snapshot.volume = src_volume return snapshot self._configuration.quobyte_volume_cache = False def test__ensure_volume_cache_ok(self): tmp_path = tempfile.mkdtemp() try: os.makedirs(os.path.join( tmp_path, self._driver.QUOBYTE_VOLUME_CACHE_DIR_NAME)) try: with mock.patch( 'cinder.volume.drivers.quobyte.LOG')as qb_log_mock: self._driver._ensure_volume_cache(tmp_path) assert qb_log_mock.debug.called, ( "LOG.debug was not called but should have been") assert not qb_log_mock.info.called, ( "LOG.info was called but should not have been") finally: os.rmdir(os.path.join(tmp_path, self._driver.QUOBYTE_VOLUME_CACHE_DIR_NAME)) finally: os.rmdir(tmp_path) def test__ensure_volume_cache_create(self): tmp_path = tempfile.mkdtemp() try: try: with mock.patch( 'cinder.volume.drivers.quobyte.LOG')as qb_log_mock: self._driver._ensure_volume_cache(tmp_path) assert qb_log_mock.debug.called, ( "LOG.debug was not called but should have been") assert commit_message:
Enable feature flags post-upgrade

Stable feature flags must be enabled before upgrades to ensure
the service can still start. These additional tasks check for
any disabled feature flags and enable them. This is done
immediately after upgrades so that systems can run with them
enabled striaght away.

Closes-Bug: #2038818
Change-Id: I5211a30899f544a9f7e609e85551a92b245d25bf

commit_message:
nova: unset cpu_model on aarch64

Without this, running DevStack on an `aarch64` environment will end
up in cpu_model set to "Nehalem" and cpu_mode set to "host-passthrough"
which does not work.

This patch drops that value under aarch64 environments.

Change-Id: I30be5a388dda5ccf08718670dbb14a28a4a8a8eb
(cherry picked from commit 28bed125a2555fb3da778898d6ae310175972d3c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/78/919878/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mnaser): We cannot have `cpu_model` set if the `cpu_mode` is # set to `host-passthrough`, or `nova-compute` refuses to # start. inidelete $NOVA_CONF libvirt cpu_model

commit_message:
Remove leftover OVN LB HM port upon deletion of a member

When a load balancer pool has a Health Monitor associated with it,
an OVN LB Health Monitor port is created for each backend member
subnet added.

When removing backend members, the OVN LB Health Monitor port is
cleaned up only if no more members are associated with the Health
Monitor pool. However, this assumption is incorrect. This patch
corrects this behavior by checking instead if there are more members
from the same subnet associated with the pool. It ensures that the
OVN LB Health Monitor port is deleted only when the last member from
the subnet is deleted. If the port is being used by another different
LB Health Monitor, `_clean_up_hm_port` will handle it.

Closes-Bug: #2062965
Change-Id: I4c35cc5c6af14bb208f4313bb86e3519df0a30fa
(cherry picked from commit f034bab144b68cf96c538339e389c4cc7c6d7d63)

commit_message:
Pull puppet openstack modules from unmaintained/wallaby

Branch name has moved from stable/wallaby to unmaintained/wallaby in all
puppet modules as part of switch to unmaintained phase for wallaby.

This change also required removing usage of retired modules:
- panko
- ec2api
- sahara
- amqp
- qdr

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/32/920832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This is an experimental workflow which acts as an alternative to enrolling nodes through inspection. Bare metal compute nodes can be registered in Ironic via Kayobe if defined in the Kayobe inventory. An example hosts file for group r1 is below: [r1] hv100 ipmi_address=1.2.3.4 ... [baremetal-compute:children] r1 You should also define a ``group_vars`` file for this group containing the Ironic variables, this could be in ``etc/kayobe/inventory/group_vars/r1/ironic_vars`` or in the environment you are using. ironic_driver: redfish ironic_driver_info: redfish_system_id: "{{ ironic_redfish_system_id }}" redfish_address: "{{ ironic_redfish_address }}" redfish_username: "{{ ironic_redfish_username }}" redfish_password: "{{ ironic_redfish_password }}" redfish_verify_ca: "{{ ironic_redfish_verify_ca }}" ipmi_address: "{{ ipmi_address }}" ironic_properties: capabilities: "{{ ironic_capabilities }}" ironic_resource_class: "example_resource_class" ironic_redfish_system_id: "/redfish/v1/Systems/System.Embedded.1" ironic_redfish_verify_ca: "{{ inspector_rule_var_redfish_verify_ca }}" ironic_redfish_address: "{{ ipmi_address }}" ironic_redfish_username: "{{ inspector_redfish_username }}" ironic_redfish_password: "{{ inspector_redfish_password }}" ironic_capabilities: "boot_option:local,boot_mode:uefi" It is essential that the Ironic username and password match the BMC username and password for your nodes. If the username and password combination is not the same for the entire group you will need to adjust your configurationInspector is not used to discover nodes and no node inspection will take place on enrollment, nodes will automatically be placed into ``manageable`` state. To inspect, you should use ``kayobe baremetal compute inspect`` following enrollment.

To inspect, you should use ``kayobe baremetal compute inspect`` following enrollment.

commit_message:
Cache secret for the duration of the hook

Getting a secret content from the controller is quite the expensive
operation, cache the secret for the duration of the hook to speed up
hook execution.

cache the `access-credentials` secret from the ceph-access relation
cache the `credentials` secret from the identity-credentials relation

Partial-Bug: #2065866
Change-Id: I4d82baf9a41ccff1129f462f3a00676baf9d6d5e

set_gateway_mtu runs for all the gateway ports for a network

To handle this we need to add if_exists=True to the transaction
but for that it needs to be supported in ovsdbapp. It's fixed

commit_message:
[stable only] Do not fail on missing logical router ports

set_gateway_mtu runs for all the gateway ports for a network
and if one of the ports get's deleted in meanwhile
whole transaction fails.

To handle this we need to add if_exists=True to the transaction
but for that it needs to be supported in ovsdbapp. It's fixed
in ovsdbapp with [1] but would require to bump ovsdbapp
minimal version in requirements.txt which we normally don't
do for stable branches.

So using "update_lrouter_port" instead as that have the
required option available. Before [2] that was only used
but during the switch if_exists part was missed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/I56685478214aae7b6d3a2a3187297ad4eb1869a3
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/762695

Closes-Bug: #2065701
Related-Bug: #2060163
Change-Id: I447990509cdea9830228d3bc92a97062cc57a472
(cherry picked from commit 5bdd0efb3970a52c60043f166bc728778ac3f395)
Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/fake_resources.py

commit_message:
Fix compatibility with SQLAlchemy 2.0

* The str(url) function in SQLAlchemy hides the password. For a URL
  string that is to be re-used, use
  render_as_string(hide_password=False) .

* attribute_mapped_collection was renamed to attribute_keyed_dict

* Fix Too many positional arguments for constructor call

Co-Authored-By: Mike Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
Change-Id: I8419f508f0185d2a896f5fc801145f945181d999
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-sfc refs/changes/46/920046/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: libvirt: Add retry on device job operation timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-02-05 13:09:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/744656d0209d74c0d62e6b722a7da1cd151c982e', 'message': "libvirt: Add retry on device job operation timeout

In qcow2 backend, during live snapshot, nova polls device block job to
figure out when it's done, and then abort.

This change implements a retry on device block job operation that may
fail in busy environment with libvirt.VIR_ERR_OPERATION_TIMEOUT error [1].

It also add CONF.libvirt.device_job_retry_count setting to set max retry
attempts number.

In case where device abort_job is run to ensure there is no more job
running, retry decorator will then log a stack trace each time
there is no job.
This change add the possibility to catch/pass VIR_ERR_OPERATION_INVALID
in such case and avoid log noise.

[1] Ex: 'Timed out during operation: cannot acquire state change lock'

Change-Id: Iea1ee03f8cd7f5b004b4ce9b5f2429b7e1380edc
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2024-05-30 15:30:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/conf/libvirt.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_guest.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d01cdb92c6333e436dbe6ac0275446af4d6e8d92', 'message': "libvirt: Add retry on device job operation timeout

Change-Id: Iea1ee03f8cd7f5b004b4ce9b5f2429b7e1380edc
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Add retry on device job operation timeout

In qcow2 backend, during live snapshot, nova polls device block job to
figure out when it's done, and then abort.

This change implements a retry on device block job operation that may
fail in busy environment with libvirt.VIR_ERR_OPERATION_TIMEOUT error [1].

It also add CONF.libvirt.device_job_retry_count setting to set max retry
attempts number.

In case where device abort_job is run to ensure there is no more job
running, retry decorator will then log a stack trace each time
there is no job.
This change add the possibility to catch/pass VIR_ERR_OPERATION_INVALID
in such case and avoid log noise.

[1] Ex: 'Timed out during operation: cannot acquire state change lock'

Change-Id: Iea1ee03f8cd7f5b004b4ce9b5f2429b7e1380edc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/907730/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def abort_job(self, async_=False, pivot=False, ignore_invalid=False): """Request to cancel any job currently running on the block. :param async_: Request only, do not wait for completion :param pivot: Pivot to new file when ending a copy or active commit job :param ignore_invalid: pass VIR_ERR_OPERATION_INVALID, this will avoid retry decorator to log when there is nojob. @loopingcall.RetryDecorator(max_retry_count=CONF.libvirt. device_job_retry_count, inc_sleep_time=2, max_sleep_time=5, exceptions=RuntimeError) def do_abort_job(async_, pivot, ignore_invalid): flags = async_ and libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_JOB_ABORT_ASYNC or 0 flags |= pivot and libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_JOB_ABORT_PIVOT or 0 try: self._guest._domain.blockJobAbort(self._disk, flags=flags) except libvirt.libvirtError as ex: if ex.get_error_code() == libvirt.VIR_ERR_OPERATION_TIMEOUT: LOG.warning("Hit VIR_ERR_OPERATION_TIMEOUT while " "aborting block job info msg: %(err)s.", {'err': ex.get_error_message()}) raise RuntimeError(ex.get_error_message()) elif ex.get_error_code() == libvirt.VIR_ERR_INVALID_ARG: if ignore_invalid: return raise do_abort_job(async_, pivot, ignore_invalid) @loopingcall.RetryDecorator(max_retry_count=CONF.libvirt. device_job_retry_count, inc_sleep_time=2, max_sleep_time=5, exceptions=RuntimeError) def do_get_job_info(): try: status = self._guest._domain.blockJobInfo(self._disk, flags=0) except libvirt.libvirtError as ex: if ex.get_error_code() == libvirt.VIR_ERR_OPERATION_TIMEOUT: LOG.warning("Hit VIR_ERR_OPERATION_TIMEOUT while " "getting block job info msg: %(err)s.", {'err': ex.get_error_message()}) raise RuntimeError(ex.get_error_message()) raise # The job no longer exists if not status: return None return BlockDeviceJobInfo( job=status['type'], bandwidth=status['bandwidth'], cur=status['cur'], end=status['end']) return do_get_job_info()
deleted_lines: def abort_job(self, async_=False, pivot=False): """Request to cancel a live block device job :param async_: Cancel the block device job (e.g. 'copy' or 'commit'), and return as soon as possible, without waiting for job completion :param pivot: Pivot to the destination image when ending a 'copy' or "active commit" (meaning: merging the contents of current active disk into its backing file) job flags = async_ and libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_JOB_ABORT_ASYNC or 0 flags |= pivot and libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_JOB_ABORT_PIVOT or 0 self._guest._domain.blockJobAbort(self._disk, flags=flags) status = self._guest._domain.blockJobInfo(self._disk, flags=0) # The job no longer exists if not status: return None return BlockDeviceJobInfo( job=status['type'], bandwidth=status['bandwidth'], cur=status['cur'], end=status['end'])

subject: Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-04-29 10:27:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api-plugin-ovn/commit/f9cfe6937d84a70fdf0aa6524c23a9ae56dd63e6', 'message': 'Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to
  stable branches.

Change-Id: I891e40433c44896d4782c9437e1241d361f75974
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2024-05-01 11:44:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api-plugin-ovn/commit/a1a7fb2ee6403b07a386d423b30aa107565f251a', 'message': 'Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to

commit_message:
Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to
  stable branches.

Change-Id: I891e40433c44896d4782c9437e1241d361f75974

commit_message:
Updating openvswitch to run as child process

On containerd v1.7+ openvswitch restarts when
containerd is restarted. To prevent this add tini
and run OVS as a child process.

Change-Id: I382dc2db12ca387b6d32304315bbee35d8e00562
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/68/920768/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exec /usr/sbin/ovs-vswitchd unix:${OVS_SOCKET} \ -vconsole:emer \ -vconsole:err \ -vconsole:info \ --pidfile=${OVS_PID} \ --mlockall & ovs_pid=$! echo ${ovs_pid} > /sys/fs/cgroup/osh-openvswitch/cgroup.procs wait ${ovs_pid} exit 0

commit_message:
Pull puppet openstack modules from unmaintained/xena

Branch name has moved from stable/xena to unmaintained/xena in all
puppet modules as part of switch to unmaintained phase for xena.

This change also required removing usage of retired modules:
- ec2api
- sahara

In addition, it updates version of gem bundler in run tests.

Change-Id: I519f34f7083889f4bef9f19cd9a47f4365aa8e5f

subject: Add DPL model & liaison reset policy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-04-23 18:23:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/8a4f54117364f23fb426860c2d7c9abc052fcddb', 'message': "Add DPl model & liaison reset policy

We introduced the DPL model in 2020 and many projects tried and
continued this leadership model. One thing that lacked or did not
work out is the monitoring of liaisons activeness. We relied on
the project team liaisons to be active and if they are not or
they cannot serve in that role anymore, they modify the same
in project.yaml. Also, TC members are to keep monitoring the liaison's
status at regular intervals. But none of these things helped and
there were cases that liaisons were not active and so was the project.

To have an easy monitoring policy, this change proposes the policy and
timeline to reset the DPL model and liaison status so that we can
explicitly know the status and if any project would like to continue
the DPL model they need to opt-in the same every year.

Change-Id: I915e55f8e6175185658cb60d369b3f649e964db0

commit_message:
Add DPL model & liaison reset policy

We introduced the DPL model in 2020 and many projects tried and
continued this leadership model. One thing that lacked or did not
work out is the monitoring of liaisons activeness. We relied on
the project team liaisons to be active and if they are not or
they cannot serve in that role anymore, they modify the same
in project.yaml. Also, TC members are to keep monitoring the liaison's
status at regular intervals. But none of these things helped and
there were cases that liaisons were not active and so was the project.

To have an easy monitoring policy, this change proposes a TC liaison
as a required liaison for the DPL projects who will monitor the
project activities as well as reset the DPL model and liaison status.
This way we can explicitly know if DPL liaisons are active and if any
project would like to continue the DPL model they need to opt-in every
cycle.

Change-Id: I915e55f8e6175185658cb60d369b3f649e964db0

added_lines: This document outlines a process for OpenStack project teams to opt in to aThe DPL model will not change how the PTL with liaisons work:DPL model & liaison duration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~for a DPL liaison is one year (two cycles). After the liaison term is over, TC will reset the project team leadership model to PTL and the project team needs to opt-in to the DPL model explicitly with same or new liaisons. TC should reste the DPL model before the next election nominations start. To avoid outdated information, TC members are encouraged to follow a project team with distributed leadership will query, at regular intervals, if the liaisons for the team are still valid. It is expected to have the liaisons answer on the
deleted_lines: This resolution outlines a process for OpenStack project teams to opt in to aThis resolution will not change how the PTL with liaisons work:Liaison assignment duration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~for a team's liaison is unlimited in time. To avoid outdated information, a TC member dedicated to follow a project team with distributed leadership will query, at regular intervals (once per cycle), if the liaisons for the team are still valid. It is expected to have the liaisons answer on the* A follow-up patch on this resolution will change the "liaisons" field to adapt its current structure, to add the new mandatory roles, next to the already present list of TC members liaising for the team.

commit_message:
Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to
  stable branches.

Change-Id: Ia11aaea0a10b24b1370d7f23470cea6eaf20f1a7

commit_message:
Add manage_package to RBD backend

Ability to not manage the ceph-common package by setting
this to false (Default: true)

Change-Id: I1f51d9ed3f4862f2c0e357cb86e7469333c2c208
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/03/920603/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'rbd backend without managing package' do before do params.merge!( :manage_package => false ) end it { is_expected.to_not contain_package('ceph-common') } end

commit_message:
Use only keystone roles in keystone RBAC tests

- don't use the load-balancer_* roles, they may not exist (and they don't
  do anything) in this configuration
- create a temporary user with a temporary non-member role

Change-Id: I9fc26307f64a2eccbbaf2d979e44fa668328565f

If provided, the check is performed using an ssl connection. if not sslinfo: cmd = ['nc', '-z', address, str(port)] result = subprocess.call(cmd) return not (bool(result)) try: with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM, 0) as sock: ssock = sslinfo.ssl_context.wrap_socket(sock, server_hostname=address) ssock.connect((address, port)) # this bit is crucial to ensure tls close_notify is sent ssock.unwrap() return True except ConnectionRefusedError: return False

commit_message:
WIP: detect snapshot deletion failure rather than timing out

This checks for "error_deleting" during snapshot deletion
rather than testing only for deletion and then timing out in
the case when deletion fails.

This should probably be cleaned up and pushed up into a more
general tempest library location, but it's a POC for now.

Also, use create_volume(, wait_until='available') where possible
to make the tests more readable.

Change-Id: I4269b8d1069271edabfd7f07ead4a9f53590707e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin refs/changes/60/917760/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time from tempest.lib import exceptions from tempest.lib.common.utils import test_utils def _get_snapshot_state(self, snap_id): try: snap = self.snapshots_client.show_snapshot(snap_id) except exceptions.NotFound: return True return snap['snapshot']['status'] def _wait_for_snapshot_deletion_or_failure(self, snap_id): # Based on tempest.lib.common.rest_client.wait_for_resource_deletion. # Fails if the snapshot goes into an error state during deletion # rather than spinning on the error state until timeout. FAILURE_STATES = ('error_deleting', ) start_time = int(time.time()) while True: snap_state = self._get_snapshot_state(snap_id) if snap_state is True: return if snap_state in FAILURE_STATES: raise exceptions.TempestException('snapshot deletion failed') if int(time.time()) - start_time >= self.snapshots_client.build_timeout: message = ('Failed to delete %(resource_type)s %(id)s within ' 'the required time (%(timeout)s s). Timer started ' 'at %(start_time)s. Timer ended at %(end_time)s. ' 'Waited for %(wait_time)s s.' % {'resource_type': self.resource_type, 'id': id, 'timeout': self.snapshots_client.build_timeout, 'start_time': start_time, 'end_time': int(time.time()), 'wait_time': int(time.time()) - start_time}) caller = test_utils.find_test_caller() if caller: message = '(%s) %s' % (caller, message) raise exceptions.TimeoutException(message) time.sleep(self.snapshots_client.build_interval) self._wait_for_snapshot_deletion_or_failure(snap_id)

commit_message:
HPE 3par - Add NVMe FC support

This patch adds support for NVMe FC protocol.

The NVMe ports are used over FC ports as shown in output below.
While creating host entry on array, NQN of host is used.
For attach volume to host, the FC ports (and its wwn) are used.

s042N cli% showport -vpi
N:S:P   Mode     State --Node_WWN/IP--- -Port_WWN/HW_Addr- Type Protocol VPI
0:3:1 target     ready 2FF70002AC02B114   20310002AC02B114 host       FC   0
0:3:1 target     ready 2FF70102AC02B114   20310102ADF2B114 free     NVMe  31
1:3:1 target     ready 2FF70002AC02B114   21310002AC02B114 host       FC   0
1:3:1 target     ready 2FF70102AC02B114   21310102ADF2B114 free     NVMe  31

Change-Id: Ibd1e9c59701072b6da479b610e7e9475e6d5b7dd

added_lines: self.client_login() def get_active_nvme_target_ports(self, remote_client=None): ports = self.get_active_target_ports(remote_client) if remote_client: client_obj = remote_client else: client_obj = self.client nvme_ports = [] for port in ports: if port['protocol'] == client_obj.PORT_PROTO_NVME: nvme_ports.append(port) virtual_ports = port.get('virtualPorts', None) if virtual_ports: for vp in virtual_ports: if vp['protocol'] == client_obj.PORT_PROTO_NVME: nvme_ports.append(port) return nvme_ports

commit_message:
object-storage: clean up orphan segment parts in MPU

Overwriting an SLO object with a new object would result in
the SLO parts to not be valid anymore, but still take disk
space (called orphan parts). These orphans should be removed
to clear disk space.

In the case of MPU, it always registers the file presently
being uploaded as soon as it starts. This prevents that,
if the upload is unfinished, the orphans left behind can
be collected. This registry is then removed when the
upload finishes, regardless of completion or abortion

It also checks for existing SLO objects in the same path,
registering it if needed when the upload is completed.

This is very based on obj/expirer, working mostly the same
way.

On behalf of Magalu at https://magalu.cloud/

Partial-Bug: #1813202

added_lines: [object-s3_slo_expirer] # If this true, this expirer will execute tasks from legacy expirer task queue, # at least one object server should run with dequeue_from_legacy = true # dequeue_from_legacy = false # # Note: Be careful not to enable ``dequeue_from_legacy`` on too many expirers # as all legacy tasks are stored in a single hidden account and the same hidden # containers. On a large cluster one may inadvertently make the # acccount/container server for the hidden too busy. # # Note: the processes and process options can only be used in conjunction with # notes using `dequeue_from_legacy = true`. These options are ignored on nodes # with `dequeue_from_legacy = false`. # # processes is how many parts to divide the legacy work into, one part per # process that will be doing the work # processes set 0 means that a single legacy process will be doing all the work # processes can also be specified on the command line and will override the # config value # processes = 0 # # process is which of the parts a particular legacy process will work on # process can also be specified on the command line and will override the config # value # process is "zero based", if you want to use 3 processes, you should run # processes with process set to 0, 1, and 2 # process = 0 # # internal_client_conf_path = /etc/swift/internal-client.conf # # You can override the default log routing for this app here (don't use set!): # log_name = object-expirer # log_facility = LOG_LOCAL0 # log_level = INFO # log_address = /dev/log # # interval = 300.0 # # report_interval = 300.0 # # request_tries is the number of times the expirer's internal client will # attempt any given request in the event of failure. The default is 3. # request_tries = 3 # # concurrency is the level of concurrency to use to do the work, this value # must be set to at least 1 # concurrency = 1 # # deletes can be ratelimited to prevent the expirer from overwhelming the cluster # tasks_per_second = 50.0 # # The expirer will re-attempt expiring if the source object is not available # up to reclaim_age seconds before it gives up and deletes the entry in the # queue. # reclaim_age = 604800 # # recon_cache_path = /var/cache/swift # # The expirer will not delete objects whose tasks have been registered recently, # only those older than ttl seconds. Default is a week. # This is because MPUs that are midway inherently have parts without a parent # concrete object, it is created when the upload is eventually finished. # ttl = 604800 # # You can set scheduling priority of processes. Niceness values range from -20 # (most favorable to the process) to 19 (least favorable to the process). # nice_priority = # # You can set I/O scheduling class and priority of processes. I/O niceness # class values are realtime, best-effort and idle. I/O niceness # priority is a number which goes from 0 to 7. The higher the value, the lower # the I/O priority of the process. Work only with ionice_class. # ionice_class = # ionice_priority = # # The expirer can delay the reaping of expired objects on disk (and in # container listings) with an account level or container level delay_reaping # time. # After the delay_reaping time has passed objects will be reaped as normal. # You may configure this delay_reaping value in seconds with dynamic config # option names prefixed with delay_reaping_<ACCT> for account level delays # and delay_reaping_<ACCT>/<CNTR> for container level delays. # Special characters in <ACCT> or <CNTR> should be quoted. # The delay_reaping value should be a float value greater than or equal to # zero. # A container level delay_reaping does not require an account level # delay_reaping but overrides the account level delay_reaping for the same # account if it exists. # For example: # delay_reaping_AUTH_test = 300.0 # delay_reaping_AUTH_test2 = 86400.0 # delay_reaping_AUTH_test/test = 400.0 # delay_reaping_AUTH_test/test2 = 600.0 # delay_reaping_AUTH_test/special%0Achars%3Dshould%20be%20quoted # N.B. By default no delay_reaping value is configured for any accounts or # containers.

commit_message:
object-storage: clean up orphan segments daemon

Overwriting an SLO object with a new object would result in
the SLO parts to not be valid anymore, but still take disk
space (called orphan parts). These orphans should be removed
to clear disk space.

To actually collect the objects, a daemon was created to
retrieve task objects registered by s3api middlewares.
It considers a TTL for objects so it doesn't delete parts
of ongoing uploads.

This is very based on obj/expirer, working mostly the same
way.

On behalf of Magalu at https://magalu.cloud/

Partial-Bug: #1813202
Change-Id: I087d7f4840f651dd607cac12a4230f95082f2368

commit_message:
Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to
  stable branches.

Change-Id: If16ea21e71051c72d608b9940bf8f8e099e13935

commit_message:
Add pre-commit configuration

'pre-commit' tool [1] provides an extensible way to configure hooks
which can be run automatically before each commit. That way we can make
sure that code send to review is passing base static analysis checks
like e.g. bandit, flake8 or hacking.

For now this is optional to use and not integrated in e.g. tox.ini file
but we can integrate it there too as next step.

[1] https://pre-commit.com/

Change-Id: I9801bc7f23add5d4540913ce12eab1716dec62e5

commit_message:
Updates for caracal testing support

These updates, on the master branch, are to support testing the caracal
packages and support of the charms for caracal.  They do NOT lock the charms
down, and don't change the testing branches to stable branches.

Change-Id: I9d7b537cba4036a2511d98338a83af7eb919e18f

commit_message:
object-storage: create and delete task objects for s3-slo-expirer

Since we're going to add new refactors to both single part and
multipart uploads, these common functions facilitate the
creation and removal of said task objects.

To add and remove task objects, pre-authed requests are used
to register metadata of the original request (including path
and upload-id of the parts) alongside a timestamp. The account
is a new configuration inside s3api.

It also ignores objects with versioning active since it is
not trivial to know whether to keep previous parts or not.
The timestamp is rounded using a new configuration.

On behalf of Magalu at https://magalu.cloud/

Related-Bug: #1813202
Change-Id: Ie46968d3cfc901396cc5829d33a38b8feac28b72

commit_message:
object-storage: clean up orphan segment parts in single upload

Overwriting an SLO object with a new object would result in
the SLO parts to not be valid anymore, but still take disk
space (called orphan parts). These orphans should be removed
to clear disk space.

In the case of uploading a simple object, it checks for
existing SLOs in the same path and registers a task to
remove those orphans in the future in an internal account.

This is very based on obj/expirer, working mostly the same
way.

On behalf of Magalu at https://magalu.cloud/

Partial-Bug: #1813202
Change-Id: I0a423dca93c0fd75e1d21469be9e49f3c8ed170f

commit_message:
[stable only] Do not fail on missing logical router ports

set_gateway_mtu runs for all the gateway ports for a network
and if one of the ports get's deleted in meanwhile
whole transaction fails.

To handle this we need to add if_exists=True to the transaction
but for that it needs to be supported in ovsdbapp. It's fixed
in ovsdbapp with [1] but would require to bump ovsdbapp
minimal version in requirements.txt which we normally don't
do for stable branches.

So using "update_lrouter_port" instead as that have the
required option available. Before [2] that was only used
but during the switch if_exists part was missed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/I56685478214aae7b6d3a2a3187297ad4eb1869a3
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/762695

Closes-Bug: #2065701
Related-Bug: #2060163
Change-Id: I447990509cdea9830228d3bc92a97062cc57a472
(cherry picked from commit 5bdd0efb3970a52c60043f166bc728778ac3f395)
Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/fake_resources.py

commit_message:
Catch all exceptions in convert_ip_to_canonical_format

Recent netaddr started to raise AttributeError for subnetpools values
like [{'start': ..., 'end': ...}].

The converter is meant to be graceful towards inputs that are not proper
ip addresses.

Instead of adding another exception type to the list and hope that the
list of expected types covers everything netaddr may raise, this patch
makes the converter catch all exceptions.

Change-Id: I967032c1dea690cd9da95ad3a8e382671186d971
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/63/917263/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception: # netaddr may raise all kinds of exceptions (ValueError, # AttributeError...) if the input is not a valid IP address. Instead of # catching them one by one, just catch all exceptions at once. # Obviously, it would be better if netaddr raised a particular # exception specific to the library. But we don't control it.

commit_message:
nova: unset cpu_model on aarch64

Without this, running DevStack on an `aarch64` environment will end
up in cpu_model set to "Nehalem" and cpu_mode set to "host-passthrough"
which does not work.

This patch drops that value under aarch64 environments.

Change-Id: I30be5a388dda5ccf08718670dbb14a28a4a8a8eb

commit_message:
Enable watcher multinode job in check

Watcher isn't very useful without multiple nodes, so enable this job
to see if it still works.

Change-Id: I402ea25174879920be78108c4d2afa7bb4051bcc

commit_message:
feat: implement support for the `cephfs-share` relation

This allows using the `cephfs-client` charm to connect
to the CephFS share without having to do a manual
setup.

Change-Id: I1823dc0624c66232cd282ed098c7a58ea7456fa8

from time import localtime, mktime, strftime, strptime, timefrom swiftclient.client import _ObjectBody self.tmpdir = tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() self.tmpdir.__enter__() self.addCleanup(lambda: self.tmpdir.__exit__(None, None, None)) # do not pollute the test running dir with stub downloads os.chdir(self.tmpdir.name) def test_stat_part_number(self, connection): argv = ["", "stat", "--part-number", "3"] with self.assertRaises(SystemExit) as caught: swiftclient.shell.main(argv) self.assertEqual(str(caught.exception), "--part-number option only allowed for " "object stats") argv = ["", "stat", "--part-number", "8", "container"] with self.assertRaises(SystemExit) as caught: swiftclient.shell.main(argv) self.assertEqual(str(caught.exception), "--part-number option only allowed for " "object stats") argv = ["", "stat", "--part-number", "20", "container", "object"] connection.return_value.head_object.return_value = {} connection.return_value.url = 'http://127.0.0.1/v1/AUTH_account' with CaptureOutput() as ctx: swiftclient.shell.main(argv) self.assertEqual([mock.call('container', 'object', headers={}, query_string='part-number=20')], connection.return_value.head_object.mock_calls) self.assertFormlessLines(""" Account: AUTH_account Container: container Object: object """, ctx.out) @mock.patch.object(swiftclient.service.SwiftService, '_stat_object', lambda *args, **kwargs: {}) @mock.patch('swiftclient.service.Connection') def test_stat_part_number_integer_errors(self, mock_connection): mock_connection.return_value.head_object.return_value = {} mock_connection.return_value.attempts = 0 def check_bad(argv): args, env = _make_cmd( 'stat', opts={}, os_opts={}, use_env=True, cmd_args=argv + ['container', 'object'] ) with mock.patch.dict(os.environ, env): with CaptureOutput() as output: self.assertRaises(SystemExit, swiftclient.shell.main, args) self.assertEqual(output.err.split("

")[0], 'ERROR: option --part-number should be ' 'a positive integer.') check_bad(["--part-number", "-1"]) check_bad(["--part-number", "-2"]) check_bad(["--part-number", "0"]) @mock.patch.object(swiftclient.service.SwiftService, '_stat_object', lambda *args, **kwargs: {}) @mock.patch('swiftclient.service.Connection') def test_stat_part_number_string_exception(self, mock_connection): mock_connection.return_value.head_object.return_value = {} mock_connection.return_value.attempts = 0 def check_bad(argv): args, env = _make_cmd( 'stat', opts={}, os_opts={}, use_env=True, cmd_args=argv + ['container', 'object'] ) with mock.patch.dict(os.environ, env): with CaptureOutput() as output: self.assertRaises(SystemExit, swiftclient.shell.main, args) self.assertEqual(output.err.split("

")[0], 'usage: Displays information for the ' 'account, container, or object.') check_bad(["--part-number", "abcde"]) check_bad(["--part-number", "1de"]) check_bad(["--part-number", "efg23"]) @mock.patch.object(swiftclient.service.SwiftService, '_download_object_job', lambda *args, **kwargs: {}) @mock.patch('swiftclient.service.Connection') def test_download_part_number_integer_errors(self, mock_connection): mock_connection.return_value.get_object.return_value = {}, '' mock_connection.return_value.attempts = 0 def check_bad(argv): args, env = _make_cmd( 'download', opts={}, os_opts={}, use_env=True, cmd_args=argv + ['container', 'object'] ) with mock.patch.dict(os.environ, env): with CaptureOutput() as output: self.assertRaises(SystemExit, swiftclient.shell.main, args) self.assertEqual(output.err.split("

")[0], 'ERROR: option --part-number should be ' 'a positive integer.') check_bad(["--part-number", "-1"]) check_bad(["--part-number", "-2"]) check_bad(["--part-number", "0"]) @mock.patch('swiftclient.service.Connection') def test_stat_version_id_and_part_number(self, connection_cls): mock_conn = connection_cls.return_value mock_conn.url = 'http://127.0.0.1/v1/AUTH_account' Length: 1000000 ETag: "cac0f63d4c7cfc6a4abdcb06b382e465" X-Static-Large-Object: True X-Object-Version-Id: 1713378563.05537 X-Manifest-Etag: b4f746e58ea5ecfa2bc6383982d6570b Content-Range: bytes 1000000-1999999/10000000 X-Parts-Count: 10 """ self.assertFormlessLines(expected_lines, ctx.out) @mock.patch('swiftclient.service.Connection') @mock.patch('swiftclient.service.Connection') def test_download_part_number(self, connection): argv = ["", "download", "--yes-all", "--part-number", "3"] with self.assertRaises(SystemExit) as caught: swiftclient.shell.main(argv) swiftclient.shell.main(argv) self.assertEqual([ mock.call('container', 'object', headers={}, response_dict={}, resp_chunk_size=65536, query_string='part-number=7') ], connection.return_value.get_object.mock_calls) @mock.patch('swiftclient.service.Connection') def test_download_version_id_and_part_number(self, connection_cls): now = time() t_start, t_auth, t_headers, t_finish = [now + (i * 0.01) for i in range(4)] mock_conn = connection_cls.return_value mock_conn.attempts = 0 mock_conn.url = 'http://127.0.0.1/v1/AUTH_account' mock_conn.auth_end_time = t_auth part_headers = { 'X-Static-Large-Object': 'True', 'Content-Length': '100000', "ETag": '"cac0f63d4c7cfc6a4abdcb06b382e465"', 'X-Manifest-Etag': 'b4f746e58ea5ecfa2bc6383982d6570b', 'Content-Range': 'bytes 100000-199999/1000000', 'X-Parts-Count': '10', 'X-Object-Version-Id': '1713378563.05537', } part_body = _ObjectBody(io.BytesIO(b'a' * 100000), chunk_size=65536, conn_to_close=None) mock_conn.get_object.return_value = ( part_headers, part_body) argv = ["", "download", "container", "obj", "--part-number", "2", "--version-id", "1713378563.05537"] with CaptureOutput() as ctx, \ mock.patch('swiftclient.service.time', side_effect=[ t_start, t_headers, t_finish]): swiftclient.shell.main(argv) self.assertEqual([ mock.call('container', 'obj', headers={}, response_dict={}, resp_chunk_size=65536, query_string='version-id=1713378563.05537&part-number=2') ], mock_conn.get_object.mock_calls) self.assertEqual( 'obj [auth 0.010s, headers 0.020s, total 0.030s, 5.000 MB/s]
', ctx.out) def assertFormlessLines(self, expected_lines, found): """ assert the lines are more ore less the same, ignore leading and trailing white space. :param expected_lines: list of lines to compare to :param found: the output to compare """ def normalize(text): return [line.strip() for line in text.strip().splitlines()] expected_lines = normalize(expected_lines) found = normalize(found) enumerated_errors = [] for i, (e, f) in enumerate(zip(expected_lines, found)): if e.strip() != f.strip(): enumerated_errors.append((i, '%r != %r' % (e, f))) def with_numbers(enumerated_lines): return '
'.join('%3d: %s' % (i, line) for i, line in enumerated_lines) if enumerated_errors: self.fail('
expected:
' '%s
' 'does not equal found:
' '%s
' 'check the following lines:
' '%s
' % ( with_numbers(enumerate(expected_lines)), with_numbers(enumerate(found)), with_numbers(enumerated_errors),) )

commit_message:
DNM: Ensure status is not None before checking for is_success

Seen in prod:

ERROR Unhandled exception in request:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ".../swift/proxy/server.py", line 608, in handle_request
    return handler(req)
  File ".../swift/proxy/controllers/base.py", line 386, in wrapped
    return func(*a, **kw)
  File ".../swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py", line 275, in GET
    return self.GETorHEAD(req)
  File ".../swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py", line 263, in GETorHEAD
    resp = self._get_or_head_response(req, node_iter, partition, policy)
  File ".../swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py", line 3061, in _get_or_head_response
    if not statuses and is_success(best_bucket.status) and \
  File ".../swift/common/http.py", line 34, in is_success
    return 200 <= status <= 299
TypeError: '<=' not supported between instances of 'int' and 'NoneType'

Avoid the error and dump a bunch more info about what's going on when it
comes up.

Change-Id: I12e4a5c39401f09ab1b7a27438b6aa0495345aad

subject: Add pre-commit configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-02 13:02:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/commit/3a2fcf368f7e0ade707d61fd111dacc42d3ee212', 'message': "Add pre-commit configuration

'pre-commit' tool [1] provides an extensible way to configure hooks
which can be run automatically before each commit. That way we can make
sure that code send to review is passing base static analysis checks
like e.g. bandit, flake8 or hacking.

For now this is optional to use and not integrated in e.g. tox.ini file

commit_message:
Add pre-commit configuration

'pre-commit' tool [1] provides an extensible way to configure hooks
which can be run automatically before each commit. That way we can make
sure that code send to review is passing base static analysis checks
like e.g. bandit, flake8 or hacking.

For now this is optional to use and not integrated in e.g. tox.ini file
but we can integrate it there too as next step.

[1] https://pre-commit.com/

Change-Id: Ic3ec4d699b80d2e31fa8d52da71069b3f1104d9b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/59/917959/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- default_language_version: # force all unspecified python hooks to run python3 python: python3 repos: - repo: https://github.com/pre-commit/pre-commit-hooks rev: v4.5.0 hooks: - id: trailing-whitespace - id: mixed-line-ending args: ['--fix', 'lf'] exclude: '.*\.(svg)$' - id: check-byte-order-marker - id: check-executables-have-shebangs - id: check-merge-conflict - id: debug-statements - id: check-yaml - repo: https://github.com/lucas-c/pre-commit-hooks rev: v1.5.4 hooks: - id: remove-tabs exclude: '.*\.(svg)$' - repo: https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking rev: 6.1.0 hooks: - id: hacking additional_dependencies: ['neutron-lib'] exclude: '^(doc|releasenotes|tools)/.*$' - repo: local hooks: - id: flake8 name: flake8 additional_dependencies: - hacking>=6.1.0,<6.2.0 - neutron-lib language: python entry: flake8 files: '^.*\.py$' exclude: '^(doc|releasenotes|tools)/.*$' # todo(slaweq): enable pylint check once all issues in the current code will # be solved # - id: pylint # name: pylint # entry: .tox/pep8/bin/pylint # files: ^networking-bgpvpn/ # language: system # types: [python] # args: ['--rcfile=.pylintrc', '--output-format=colorized']

subject: Allow restoration of tun_ofports on agent restart
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-04 15:13:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fa06a40ec014a57b9e50704a54a92e2a785ef5e6', 'message': 'Allow restoration of tun_ofports on agent restart

When OVS agent is restarting, it is restoring the local vlan from
integration bridge in self._local_vlan_hints.

The purpose of this patch is to add tun_ofports info in this
self._local_vlan_hints so we can also restore the tunnel bridge openflow
rules correctly.

Without this, we can end-up in a situation where the openflows rules on
tunnel bridge are created too late after the cleanup_stale_flows.
If some openflow rules are missing, for ex in table=22, then the
flooding in tunnels would be broken.
If flooding is broken, multicast VRRP packets used by keepalived could
not reach other keepalived processes and routers starts performing HA.

Related-Bug: #1978088

Change-Id: Ifecd7fa875c930959c4e53672237a4ff74b292c3
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>

'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2022-12-12 09:18:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2e8778029daed9038d0795f0274ac6afe8c07f28', 'message': 'Allow restoration of tun_ofports on agent restart

When OVS agent is restarting, it is restoring the local vlan from
integration bridge in self._local_vlan_hints.

The purpose of this patch is to add tun_ofports info in this
self._local_vlan_hints so we can also restore the tunnel bridge openflow
rules correctly.

Without this, we can end-up in a situation where the openflows rules on
tunnel bridge are created too late after the cleanup_stale_flows.

This can happen when the agents are receiving RPC messages that finally
call add_fdb_flow function.
But, the first RPC loop (iter 0) may finish before all add_fdb_flow are
successfully executed.
Because cleanup_stale_flows method is called at the end of the first
iteration, some openflow rules are cleared from table=22 before beeing
added again.

If some openflow rules are missing in table=22, then the flooding in
tunnels would be broken.
If flooding is broken, multicast VRRP packets used by keepalived could
not reach other keepalived processes and routers starts performing HA.

With that patch, we collect the output for tunnels in table=22 and store
them in _local_vlan_hints during restart.
Then when the vlan will be configured (in provision_local_vlan), we will
configure the tunnel outputs correctly.

Related-Bug: #1978088

Change-Id: Ifecd7fa875c930959c4e53672237a4ff74b292c3
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>

When OVS agent is restarting, it is restoring the local vlan from
integration bridge in self._local_vlan_hints.

The purpose of this patch is to add tun_ofports info in this
self._local_vlan_hints so we can also restore the tunnel bridge openflow
rules correctly.

Without this, we can end-up in a situation where the openflows rules on
tunnel bridge are created too late after the cleanup_stale_flows.

This can happen when the agents are receiving RPC messages that finally
call add_fdb_flow function.
But, the first RPC loop (iter 0) may finish before all add_fdb_flow are
successfully executed.
Because cleanup_stale_flows method is called at the end of the first
iteration, some openflow rules are cleared from table=22 before beeing
added again.

If some openflow rules are missing in table=22, then the flooding in
tunnels would be broken.
If flooding is broken, multicast VRRP packets used by keepalived could
not reach other keepalived processes and routers starts performing HA.

With that patch, we collect the output for tunnels in table=22 and store
them in _local_vlan_hints during restart.
Then when the vlan will be configured (in provision_local_vlan), we will
configure the tunnel outputs correctly.

Related-Bug: #1978088

Change-Id: Ifecd7fa875c930959c4e53672237a4ff74b292c3
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>

commit_message:
Allow restoration of tun_ofports on agent restart

When OVS agent is restarting, it is restoring the local vlan from
integration bridge in self._local_vlan_hints.

The purpose of this patch is to add tun_ofports info in this
self._local_vlan_hints so we can also restore the tunnel bridge openflow
rules correctly.

Without this, we can end-up in a situation where the openflows rules on
tunnel bridge are created too late after the cleanup_stale_flows.

This can happen when the agents are receiving RPC messages that finally
call add_fdb_flow function.
But, the first RPC loop (iter 0) may finish before all add_fdb_flow are
successfully executed.
Because cleanup_stale_flows method is called at the end of the first
iteration, some openflow rules are cleared from table=22 before beeing
added again.

If some openflow rules are missing in table=22, then the flooding in
tunnels would be broken.
If flooding is broken, multicast VRRP packets used by keepalived could
not reach other keepalived processes and routers starts performing HA.

With that patch, we collect the output for tunnels in table=22 and store
them in _local_vlan_hints during restart.
Then when the vlan will be configured (in provision_local_vlan), we will
configure the tunnel outputs correctly.

Related-Bug: #1978088

Change-Id: Ifecd7fa875c930959c4e53672237a4ff74b292c3
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/70/860270/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: side_effect=[get_interfaces, get_ports]) as gpa,\ mock.patch.object(self.agent.tun_br, 'get_flood_to_tun_ofports') as gftto: gftto.return_value = set() expected_hints[key] = {'vlan': tag, 'tun_ofports': set()}
deleted_lines: side_effect=[get_interfaces, get_ports]) as gpa: expected_hints[key] = tag

commit_message:
Add tini with openvswitch

Containerd v1.7+ will stop openvswitch when
restarted so we need to run openvswitch as a child
process, requiring tini.

Change-Id: I2484308d1dff326db18b181051d1c4fa24511bbe

commit_message:
Configure all directories to be safe for git clone in CI

CI jobs use the file:// mechanism to clone their repos and this is
now subject to 'safe' directory rules in lastest git.

See https://github.com/git/git/commit/f4aa8c8bb11dae6e769cd930565173808cbb69c8

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/+/920757
Change-Id: I20efb9be544db6d4d66c9b8d968aaf44d96d899f

commit_message:
api: canonicalize ipv6 addresses in `subnet:allocation_pools` field

Before the patch, `start` and `end` addresses in `allocation_pools` were
never canonicalized because an invalid converter was used for this field
that assumed a string as an input format, and not a list of dicts with
`start` and `end` keys, which is the correct format for the field.

The original invalid converter was added in
Ibef0bd9a2f7b7dd8ddccc183f17aa31e426c7fd0.

Related-Bug: #1531103
Change-Id: If768ab6a5f92d200841a734087bbc8fba8870dc6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/49/918149/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def convert_allocation_pools_to_canonical_format(value): """Convert allocation pools to canonical format. :param value: The allocation pools which need to be checked. :returns: - Allocation pools with addresses in canonical format. """ return [ { k: convert_ip_to_canonical_format(v) for k, v in pool.items() } for pool in value ]

commit_message:
Handle invalid configuration for vif test execution

It is entirely possible to run the tempest tests without a physical
network parameter for the compute service. Turns out the network is
required when you use [network]shared_physical_network set to true,
because without it we can't figure out how to attach to the network.

So now we skip when the input configuration is such that there is
no way for the tests to proceed.

Closes-Bug: 2065378
Change-Id: Ic448a1a6383c2da2567b9da2262d4572536296ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin refs/changes/44/919544/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not CONF.compute.fixed_network_name: raise cls.skipException( 'Unable to perform vif test as there is no network ' 'defined for the [compute]fixed_network_name ' 'parameter.')
